intro: Psychotria ternifolia, commonly known as the "Bishop's weed" or "Cocaine plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It contains alkaloids, including psychotrimine and cocaine, which have been studied for their pharmacological properties. Due to its psychoactive compounds, it is also of interest in ethnobotanical and medicinal research.
